item.title: Maintenance Over Notice
item.description:
Dear Wanderers,

Today's maintenance is over. Thank you for your understanding, patience and support!

◤Compensation◢
Maintenance compensation: 300 dark crystals
Achievement Issue Compensation: 300 mira
- Compensation eligibility: Reach Wanderer Lv. 6 before the update
- We will deliver the aforementioned compensation to you via mail within 2 hours after the maintenance. Do remember to check your mailbox and claim them

◤Updates◢
1. Annabella Limited Cache available on: (UTC+0) 2023/1/12 03:00–2023/2/1 21:00
2. Annabella Couture Gift Pack available on: (UTC+0) 2023/1/12 03:00–2023/2/1 05:00
3. Ruby Couture Skin: Crimson Ruby Event available on: (UTC+0) 2023/1/19 03:00–2023/1/26 3:00
4. New Relic: Couant 2 (Shares the same cooldown with Relic Couant shard 1)
5. Added Ray Tracing in the PC version. Become available after fulfilling the following requirements:
a) Use Nvidia GPUs that support Ray Tracing
b) Update to the latest GPU driver and enable DirectX 12 in the settings on the upper right corner of the launcher (If your operating system is Windows 10, it might have been enabled by default)
c) Enable Ray Tracing in the game settings

◤Bug Fix Compensation◢
1. Fixed the incorrect display of the Mirroria Racing leaderboard
2. Due to existing bugs, the Emperor's New Clothes achievement was unable to be completed, and we are now making it hidden. We will be issuing 300 mira as the achievement reward within 2 hours after the update is finished via mail.
3. Removed the crit resistance property of the Stress-Relief Cactus in Mirroria

◤Known Issues◢
1. When the ping is too high, there might be an issue where Wanderers cannot successfully bump off other Wanderers in the Floating Bumpers gameplay.

Sincerely,
Tower of Fantasy Team

item.title: It’s fixed! №70
item.description:
In this digest we would like to tell you about our continuing work on improvements and fixes in the game. You can find information about all updates that have been released in War Thunder on the website special section.

Please feel free to leave your feedback on these changes in the dedicated "It’s fixed! №70" thread

Punching through fences



Many structures in the maps for ground battles serve two purposes: creating a believable environment and providing some cover for the warriors to hide behind. Some destructible structures, however, went above and beyond their purpose and decided to not just hide the fighters but also shield them from fire! Sure, they were destroyed in the process, as they should have, but the enemy that was hiding behind them got a free chance at counterattack instead of deserved damage.

The error has been fixed: feel free to shoot right through fences and structures without fear that some dilapidated shack will impede your attack.


More HMD options



We’re always working on giving the players more options. Soon in air battles "Radar/IRST beyond/within visual range combat” option will be another sensor mode that will be added that allows a helmet-mounted display to be used for target designation.

Note that IR AAM seekers are always controlled via HMD.


Fixing the MiG-29



We’re also improving the new vehicles that have recently been added in the Apex Predators update. In particular we’ve discovered that the R-27R/ER missiles received data link updates from TWS trackfiles, and fixed it. Now the MiG-29 will receive data link updates from hard lock on by the radar only, while the F-14 with its AIM-54 missiles will receive them from both hard lock on and TWS. MiG-29’s seekers will also be disabled as soon as target lock is released.


Saving your camo settings



The recent War Thunder update added an option to customise the condition, scale and rotation of naval camouflage. However, switching between crew slots reset the changes back to default.

We’ve fixed it: rest assured that your camo settings will now not be lost.


Carbon emissions



We live in an age of electric cars and strive to reduce carbon emissions. It might have seemed that the “Assault” mode was setting an example: ground vehicles in that mode suddenly stopped “smoking” at all!

But alas, it was an error: after all, War Thunder is all about realistic vehicles, and these 20th century tanks with internal combustion engines that weren’t too concerned about the environment. So now they’re fuming once again, as they should.


That’s Not All

You’ll find the full list of improvements in the separate changelog - there are many interesting things there. Order of ammo depletion has been adjusted for numerous ground vehicles, the Z-10 helicopter no longer obstructs the view when zoomed in, and the G indicator in cockpit view of the F-16A now displays correct values.

More improvements

For this digest we have prepared a large set of useful fixes and game improvements. Be sure to read the full list below - there are many interesting things.

Once again, many thanks for all your bug reports that you submitted using our special service.

Update 2.23.0.51

Aircraft
  • "Radar/IRST beyond/within visual range combat” option now works with the helmet-mounted display.
  • AD-4 — an issue has been fixed with the missing pylon for the FFAR Mighty Mouse rocket pod on the right wing.
  • Harrier GR.7 — a bug has been fixed that prevented the MAX G indicator to switch off while landing.
  • Hampden TB Mk.I — a bug has been fixed where bombs mounted in the bay were first to drop.
  • Sa.342L Gazelle — a bug has been fixed that caused a mix up of the high and low rate of fire.
  • Z-10 — the camera zoom position has been adjusted.
  • F-16A (all versions) — a bug has been fixed that caused incorrect G indication on the HUD in cockpit view (report).
  • R-27R/ER missiles — a bug has been fixed where missiles received radar correction in TWS mode. Now, the radar correction is available in the lock-on mode only, when the target is unlocked, the seeker disables.
  • AN/APG-66 — the default range scale of the radar has been changed from 18.5km to 37km.
  • Su-6 - a bug has been fixed where the total overload in the weapon customization menu was rounded to integers that resulted in an incorrect number in the weapon weight overload notification.
Ground vehicles
  • Sd.Kfz.221 - gear ratios have been adjusted, engine speed increased from 2,600 to 3,600 rpm. Frontal armour has been reduced from 14.5mm to 8mm. Source: Panzer Tracts 13-1 // Die Gepanzerten Radfahrzeuge des Deutschen Heeres
  • Sho’t - an issue with missing parts of the damage model has been solved.
  • M64, Sahariano, Churchill Crocodile, M19 (all versions), M42 (all versions), Avenger, Concept 3 NGAC, Sav m/43, Sd.Kfz.251/9, M3A1 (all versions), M3A3 (all versions), M8 Greyhound (all versions), M2 Medium, M3 GMC, Flakpanzer I, Flakpanzer 38, Jagdpanzer 38(t), Pz.35(t), Pz.38(t) A/F, Pz.Sfl.Ic, Sd.Kfz.140/1, VK 45.01 (P), Sd.Kfz.221, Sd.Kfz.234/1, Sd.Kfz.6/2, Flak 37 Sfl. — the order of ammo depletion has been adjusted. Previously, consumption of ammo might not result in the disappearance of ammo rack sections from the damage model.
  • A bug has been fixed that allows control of the soft-kill active protection system while the gunner is knocked off.
  • SU-57B — the display of the wheels have been mixed with the x-ray view in battle .
  • AMX-30 ACRA — animation of the MUC rocket in the info card has been corrected.
  • Type-75 SPH — a bug of underestimated armour penetration values on the M107 (PF) rounds in comparison with the M107 has been fixed.
  • 2S3M — a bug of the underestimated armour penetration values of the ZOF25 (RV) in comparison with the ZOF25 has been fixed.
  • ITO-90M — generation of the thermal imager of the gunner’s sight has been fixed from 1 to 3 (report)
  • 5.56, 5.8mm machine guns — a bug with missing localization of the ammo belt has been corrected (report)
  • Destructible objects, such as fences, pillars, etc. will not stop the kinetic rounds anymore.
Naval
  • USS Newport News - the year of the ship modification in the vehicle card has been changed from 1962 to 1972.
  • Letuchiy - Firing sector of the 3rd and 4th main calibre turrets has been corrected.
Customization and achievements
  • Lübeck - Displaying of the deforming camouflage has been fixed.
  • Resetting of the selected characteristics of the ships camouflages has been fixed.
  • Missing exhaust of the ground vehicles in the Assault game mode has been fixed.
Other
  • Winter holidays hangar has been switched off.
The current provided changelog reflects the major changes within the game as part of this Update. Some updates, additions and fixes may not be listed in the provided notes. War Thunder is constantly improving and specific fixes may be implemented without the client being updated.

item.title: Hyper Ignition Events
item.description:
The party isn't over yet with a trio of new Hyper Ignition Events to give you even more rewards, more Ignition Coins, and more fun to have!
[Hyper Ignition] Wonky the Fairy's Hyper Time
  • PST (UTC -8): Tuesday, January 10, 2023 4:00 PM - Tuesday, February 7, 2023 3:59 PM
  • CET (UTC +1): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 1:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 12:59 AM
  • AEDT (UTC +11): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 11:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 10:59 AM
Event Details:
  • Enjoy the missions and rewards prepared by Wonky the Fairy!
  • Requirements: Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters must have completed up to Chapter 2) that have completed the "[Hyper Ignition] The Party Continues!" quest.
  • You can start the event and daily mission via the event notifier on the left side of the screen or by speaking to Wonky the Fairy located in major towns.
  • The daily mission can be done once a day per world.
  • You can complete the mission via the quest notifier 15 minutes later and claim a reward of your choice from the list below.
  • Complete the daily mission multiple times for additional rewards.
Daily Reward Choices:


  • 3x EXP Coupon (15 min): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • Nodestone (x3): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • Arcane Symbol Selector (x5): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • Special Medal of Honor: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • Extreme Growth Potion: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • Event Ring Exclusive Meister’s Cube: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
Daily Mission (Multiple) Title Rewards:
  • Complete daily mission 5 times:
    • Weak Ember: Tradeable within account, durational stats last until the end of the event: Weapon ATT/Magic ATT +5, EXP Obtained +5%.
  • Complete daily mission 10 times:
    • Ignited Flame: Tradeable within account, durational stats last until the end of the event: Weapon ATT/Magic ATT +10, Boss Damage/Ignore Defense +5%, EXP Obtained +10%.
  • Complete daily mission 15 times:
    • Full Flame: Tradeable within account, durational stats last until the end of the event: Weapon ATT/Magic ATT +20, Boss Damage/Ignore Defense +10%, EXP Obtained +10%
[Hyper Ignition] Blake's Hyper Ignition Game!
  • PST (UTC -8): Tuesday, January 10, 2023 4:00 PM - Tuesday, February 7, 2023 3:59 PM
  • CET (UTC +1): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 1:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 12:59 AM
  • AEDT (UTC +11): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 11:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 10:59 AM


Event Details:
  • Get ready to collect letters of the alphabet to spell our related MapleStory Event terms for rewards!
  • Requirements: Lv. 101 and above characters (Zero characters must have completed up to Chapter 2) that have completed the "[Hyper Ignition] The Party Continues!" quest.
  • Defeat enemies within your level range (20 levels below and 20 levels above) to receive the Flame Alphabet Box or the Alphabet Box.
  • Open each box to receive letters of the alphabet according to the box’s type.
  • Use the letters of the alphabet you receive to complete specific words.
  • Defeat weekly bosses to receive Blake's Selection Box to select letters of the alphabet of choice.
  • You can exchange 5 letters of the alphabet that you have to get a new letters of the alphabet from the letters of the alphabet tab of the UI.

    • You get the same amount of EXP that you can get at Lv. 260 if you are Lv. 260+.
    • Burning World Leap does not carry over the Hyper Ignition Points or the Mini-game achievements.
Rewards:



Spell the following with your letters of the alphabet for rewards! (Rewards can only be claimed once per account.)
  • ENJOY:
    • Blake's First Gift: Use to obtain:
      • Karma Powerful Rebirth Flame (x10): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
      • 3x EXP Coupon (15 min) (x10): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
    • Ignition Coin Coupon (x100): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • HYPER:
    • Blake's Second Gift: Use to obtain:
      • Karma Powerful Rebirth Flame (x10): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
      • Producer Blake's Luxury Piercing (Earrings): Untradeable, Permanent.
    • Blake's Selection Box: Tradeable, 7-day duration.
  • IGNITION:
    • Blake's Third Gift: Use to obtain:
      • Karma Powerful Rebirth Flame (x30): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.

    • Experience Nodestone: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • MAPLESTORY:
    • Blake's Fourth Gift: Use to obtain:
      • Karma Powerful Rebirth Flame (x50): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
      • Growth Potion Selector Coupon: Tradeable within account, 1-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Growth Potion (200-209) (x8): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
        • Growth Potion (200-219) (x4): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
        • Growth Potion (200-229) (x2): Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
        • Typhoon Growth Potion: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
    • Mitra's Symbol Selection Box: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.
  • ENJOY HYPER IGNITION: 
    • Blake's Fifth Gift: Use to obtain:
      • Karma Star Force 17-Star Enhancement (Lv. 200): Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
      • Black Circulator: Tradeable within account, 1-day duration.
    • Magnificent Growth Potion: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration.

      • Permanent Kerning Tower Android Heart: Untradeable, Permanent.
      • Amy Thys Android: Untradeable, Permanent.

[Hyper Ignition] Mike's Mini-game Lounge
  • PST (UTC -8): Tuesday, January 10, 2023 4:00 PM - Tuesday, February 7, 2023 3:59 PM
  • CET (UTC +1): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 1:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 12:59 AM
  • AEDT (UTC +11): Wednesday, January 11, 2023 11:00 AM - Wednesday, February 8, 2023 10:59 AM
Event Details:


  • It's time for some Mini-games and Mike's got you covered!
  • Talk to Flaming Mike in the Hyper Ignition map to access the Mini-game Lounge.
  • The mini-game available will change every 15 minutes, but you can play the Challenge Mini-game anytime.
  • Competition Mini-games:
    • One Card
      • Starts every hour on the dot.
      • Each hero will receive 7 cards when the game starts.
      • On your turn, you can select and play one card of the same color or number as the card placed in the center.
        • The cards that you can play will light up.
      • If you have no cards you can play, click the cards in the center to draw one.
      • You win by getting rid of all cards in your hand.
        • The character to get rid of all the cards the fastest is determined as the first place. The other characters will be ranked based on the remaining cards.
        • If you have 17 or more cards, you will automatically lose.
        • Cards are made up of regular cards, magic cards, attack cards, and knight cards.
        • Attack cards cannot be blocked with a weaker attack card.
      • 1st: 200 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • 2nd: 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • 3rd: 75 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • 4th: 50 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Monster Pyramid
      • Starts every hour at the 30-minute mark.
      • In Monster Pyramid, there are a total of 36 glass cups filled with monsters.
      • Three heroes are distributed with 12 glass cups each when the game begins.
      • When it's your turn, you can select 1 cup to stack it on top of another cup of the same shape.
        • However, glass cups can be placed regardless of type on the first level.
        • Special cups can be stacked on top of any cup, regardless of shape, but no cups can be stacked on top of a special cup.
      • Earn points per every glass cup that is used.
        • If the score is a tie, whoever reached the score first is ranked higher.
      • The round ends if there is a hero that placed all of their glass cups in the pyramid, or if nobody can place glass cups anymore.
      • There are a total of 3 rounds. When all rounds finish, ranks are determined based on the final amount of points.
      • 1st: 200 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • 2nd: 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • 3rd: 50 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Supernatural Yut
      • Starts every hour at the 15-minute mark.
      • You are given 2 one-time supernatural powers when the game starts.
        • Supernatural abilities can be used once per each turn, before throwing the Yut
      • Throw the Yut on your turn and move your pieces along the designated path based on the Yut results.
      • If you get a four or a five after throwing the Yut, or if you capture an opponent's piece, you can throw the Yut one more time.
      • You win if you get all 4 of your pieces to the goal first within the time limit.
      • Win: 150 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • Draw: 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • Lose: 50 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Reverse Battle
      • Starts every hour at the 45-minute mark.
      • Start game with either Slime or Pink Bean when you enter the game.
      • Slime places the stone first and then you take turns placing stones.
      • When you place a stone on your turn, flip over all stones of the opponent between the stone you just put down and the stone that was already placed, and they will be yours.
      • Flip the opponent's stone to reduce their HP, and you will win if you make their HP reach 0.
        • The game will end if there are no more places to put the stone within the time limit or if one player's HP reaches 0.
      • Win: 150 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • Draw: 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
      • Lose: 50 Hyper Ignition Points.
  • Challenge Mini-games:
    • Up and Down Seesaw
      • Hero and Wonky the Fairy begin the seesaw upon entering the mini-game.
      • Press the Interact/Harvest key when the arrow reaches the yellow area of the gauge, to successfully jump.
        • As the jump count increases, the seesaw speed will increase and the yellow area will decrease.
      • Earn points per successful jump, and earn higher points for increasing the number of successes.
      • Failing the jump, or successfully jumping 40 times will end the game.
      • Earn Hyper Ignition Points upon successful jumps.
        • 1 Hyper Ignition Point per 40 game points.
        • Max 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Ignition Party Column
      • Floors will appear one by one on the side, when the Ignition Party Column begins.
      • You can stack the floor that appears by pressing the Space key. (However, you must stack the floor within a certain range of the floor that was stacked immediately before.)
      • Earn more points by stacking the floors higher.
      • The game ends when you go outside the range of the floor that was stacked immediately before. (Or, the game ends when you reach the 5 minute time limit.)
      • Earn Hyper Ignition Points each time you build up the tower.
        • 1 Hyper Ignition Point per 10 game points.
        • Max 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Ignition Boat Rush
      • Ride the boat and use the left and right arrow keys to avoid the obstacles that appear.
      • There are a total of 3 lanes, and obstacles show up in 2 lanes.
      • Speed is gradually increased as the time passes.
      • Game ends when colliding with obstacles.
      • Earn Hyper Ignition Points per distance traveled.
        • 1 Hyper Ignition Point per 100m.
        • Max 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
    • Colorful Ignition Invitation
      • Send an invitation to DJ Selena.
      • Press the button of the same color as the invitation that appeared on the center.
        • A special invitation will appear in 3 different types and colors in Colorful Ignition Invitation, and the special invitation will keep its true form hidden until moments before sending the invitation out, and transform into one of the 3 types.
      • The Fever Gauge fills up as you send the invitations.
      • Once it's full, quickly press the Space key.
      • You can send the invitation faster.
      • Earn Hyper Ignition Points each time you send an invitation.
        • 1 Hyper Ignition Point per 800 game points.
        • Max 100 Hyper Ignition Points.
  • Game will automatically end if you do not play within the turn time limit.
  • Penalty will be applied if a set number of turns are played automatically, or you exit during the game. (Reward cannot be claimed and cannot participate in all mini game for 15 minutes)
  • Please exit by talking to NPC Flaming Mike in the exit map after the mini game has completed ended.
  • Hyper Ignition Points will not be transferred during Burning World Leap, and mini game achievements will not be maintained after Leap.
  • Depending on the game results, Hyper Ignition Points will be distributed upon exiting after playing the mini-game.
  • You can earn up to 300 Hyper Ignition Points a day per world.
    • Entry is permitted to those who earned all the available points of the day, but they cannot earn more points.
  • Lv. 200+ and Zero characters that completed Story Quest Act 2 can talk to Flaming Mike to exchange Hyper Ignition Points with EXP.
  • Talk to Flaming Mike after completing an achievement to earn set rewards per mini-game.
  • Achievement counts per mini-game will be applied per world, and each reward can be received once per world.
Rewards:


  • One Card Mini-game Reward:
    • Achieve 1st place 10 times:
      • Midnight Casual Shirt Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Casual Shirt: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Supernatural Yut Mini-game:
    • Win 10 times:
      • Midnight Paper Band Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Paper Band: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Monster Pyramid Mini-game:
    • Participate 15 times:
      • Midnight Coconut Water Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Coconut Water: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Reverse Battle Mini-game:
    • Participate 15 times:
      • Midnight Sunglasses Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Sunglasses: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Up and Down Seesaw Mini-game:
    • Successfully jump 100 times in a row:
      • Wonky Seesaw Chair Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Wonky Seesaw Chair: Tradeable within account, Permanent.
  • Ignition Party Column Mini-game:
    • Build 500 floors in a row:
      • Midnight Ignition Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Ignition: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Ignition Boat Rush Mini-game:
    • Run over 30,000m:
      • Midnight Luxury Yacht Mount Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Luxury Yacht Mount: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • Colorful Ignition Invitation Mini-game:
    • Reach over 300,000 points:
      • Midnight Twinkle Sneakers Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive:
        • Midnight Twinkle Sneakers: Untradeable, Permanent.
  • All Mini-games:
    • Complete 8 achievements:
      • Ignition Mini-game Collector Coupon: Tradeable within account, 7-day duration. Use to receive the following medal:
        • Ignition Mini-game Collector: Untradeable, Permanent.

item.title: Divination Card Stories - The Wedding Gift
item.description:
In the Forbidden Sanctum Expansion, we introduced ten new Divination Cards designed by our Supporters. For today's news post, we asked Suzu520 to share their story with us about their card "The Wedding Gift". Check out their story below!



Hello Exiles, I’m Suzu520.

Before talking about “The Wedding Gift” card design, I want to share my journey in Path of Exile. I started playing Path of Exile from the Sacrifice of the Vaal expansion. I still remember the time when I was in the Garena TW server, and people in Global chat were all asking, “Where do we find the Fetid Pool?” Such fun. There was a time where my friends and I could not beat Merciless Dominus, and a random player joined our party through the Noticeboard and cleared it with us. That was a vivid memory of Path of Exile having a very wholesome community. I have played every single league and have enjoyed the game ever since the Forsaken Masters expansion when I finally moved to the Global server from the Garena TW server.

During the closed beta of the “Fall of Oriath” expansion, the playtest was up to the end of Act 7 and that expansion of the main quest storyline shocked me to my core, especially Act 6 & 7: Nessa and Silk’s death. I love the game even more than before, I knew I wanted to design a card and give back to the community.

I am a big fan of Summoner playstyle, from Undying Evangelist Raise Spectre, 50x Summon Raging Spirits, 50x Animate Weapon, all the way up to Solar Guard Raise Spectre. One day my friend told me about the sword “The Dancing Dervish” and the respective upgrade “The Dancing Duo” back then. I had been curious about Minions that came from items instead of skill gems, so I tried it out and absolutely loved them. That was my initial idea for the card design. I wanted a card that allows SSF players to farm specific bosses for, so my original idea was a 6 White-Socketed Dancing Duo, but due to the item not being able to drop, the idea was scrapped.

During Sentinel league, I successfully reached level 100 for the first time with an Arakaali’s Fang build. The build has such a unique summoning style that I fell in love with it, and it was the first time ever I did not reroll a new character 5 days into league starting. Meanwhile, I discovered KittenCatNoodle’s Lore Series and had been listening to all her videos in the background while I was levelling to 100. That was the moment where my brain goes “Eureka!” What if I designed a card that was lore-accurate and gives my favourite summoner weapon? Coincidentally the weapon came from Arakaali, where the end of Close beta during 3.0 was, and it left a strong impression on my mind.

After finally deciding on the reward, I had to think about the art and card description. That was easy, since Silk wanted a wedding gift as we attended their fateful day. The art had to be Silk’s final moment where we and Yeena witness his union with Arakaali. Since we cannot do anything to save Silk, we could kill Arakaali as a revenge kill for Silk. As for the flavour text, people that worshipped Arakaali would be very happy about the goddess getting more human essence, hence the line “The Acolytes congratulated the lucky groom for becoming one with the Goddess.”

When the card finally got released, a few friends talked to me and said that they had always wanted to play the build but never got enough currency to do so. I’m very happy that they get to share the experience of playing Arakaali’s Fang.

That’s the end of my story, hope you all have a great New Year and may RNGesus be with you!

CONTROL LIMITED-TIME MODE IS BACK!

During the Spellbound Collection Event, Control returns: you play 9 vs. 9 and battle to control Zones on the map with infinite respawns. Control will be available to play at:

  • Storm Point: Barometer
  • World's Edge: Lava Siphon
  • Olympus: Hammond Labs

CREATE PRIVATE MATCHES





Want to host your own tournaments? Private matches are now available for all players. Get ready to generate your own tournament codes and host custom private matches.

Squad up with your friends and give it a try!

SPELLBOUND COLLECTION EVENT ITEMS

Unlock 24 enchanting limited-time cosmetics, with Legendary skins for Vantage, Seer, Mad Maggie, Mirage, and more!

All 24 items will be available through direct purchase (for Apex Coins or Crafting Metals) and in Spellbound Event Apex Packs for the entire duration of the event.

If you unlock all 24 cosmetics before the event is over, you’ll automatically receive Seer’s new Heirloom, the “Showstoppers”!

REWARD TRACKER

You can earn up to 1,600 points per day and challenges refresh daily. All these challenges also stack with your Battle Pass so you can complete multiple challenges at once.

item.title: Atrio Version 1.0 is out now!
item.description:
Hey everyone,
After a year and a half in early access, we're ready to release Atrio out into the dark wild (see what I did there??! hahaha- sorry)
We've tweaked, tuned, polished and perfected and now the game is ready for the world to enjoy.

Launch Trailer



Change overview
Story mode
The story mode is finally here! Most players take between 12-18 hours to get through, and we can't wait to see what mysteries you unfurl.
- removed the walls from early access
- Added all remaining stations
- Added ending cinematic
- Completed the dialogue for all stations

UI changes
- New title menu with new particle systems, and a higher quality background image
- Factories, smelters, scrap chests and other items have color coded UI
- Fixed an issue where buttons would double click
- Cleaned up the research menu, updated the UI

Gameplay changes
Note: To avoid spoilers, we've kept many of the changes secret (for you to discover in story mode)
- Introduced the Smoke bomb
- Updated all supply pod battles
- Introduced new type of bee that attacks the supply pod
- Tornatoads are invulnerable to smoke bombs
- Fuel depot rebalanced for the new fuel types
- Player has new death animations when killed by pushbacks
- Optimized the nav mesh so creatures use less processing power
- Polished the selection algorithm to be more intuitive for controller
- Added back in rain

We also dropped our final vlog before launch:


There are so many more changes, but we'll leave them for you to discover!



We're so, SO excited for you to discover Atrio: The Dark Wild.

Happy playing!
-Stephen & the Isto Team
